p: Samples of specimens from containers with a capacity of less than 10 liters were collected by aspiration using rubber “pears” or with the help of “shrimp nets”. In the containers with a capacity of over 10 liters, specimens were collected from the drainage system, via the flow of water through the shrimp net. In fixed and large containers, the collection of pupae was carried out by the “sweep net” method, proposed by Tun-Lin et al [ 21], modified by Kubota et al [ 22]. The collected specimens were identified with the aid of binocular bacteriologic microscopes.
